page.title: 14Religion in Warbleton
page.content: There is no place of worship in Rushlake Green apart from the parish room where services are held in the winter months. Most churchgoers go to St. Mary's, the ancient parish church a mile away. Many attend the major festivals and family weddings, christenings and funerals, but only a small minority are communicants. There is a Strict Baptist chapel at Turner's Green and Plymouth Brethren meeting house at Three Cups. Roman Catholics have to go to Heathfield 4 miles away to worship. Some young people go to the Welcome Free Church or the even more evangelical 'break-away' congre- gation meeting, both in Heathfield. So far the ecumenical movement has made little impact but Anglicans and Methodists do hold a joint service once a month and there are inter- denominational Lent groups.
